bill.title: Compulsory school attendance; increase age of and revise various provisions.
bill.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-13-91, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Age Of Compulsory School Attendance To Eighteen And To Include Under The Definition Of "compulsory-school-age Child" Certain Students Who Turn Eighteen But Have Not Yet Graduated From High School; To Authorize Certain Students Who Are Seventeen Or Eighteen Years Of Age To Withdraw From School, With The Written Consent Of Their Parents, After An Exit Interview Is Held; To Require Schools To Submit A Daily Report Of Absences To The School Attendance Officer; To Establish Penalties For Parents Of Compulsory-school-age Children Who Fail To Require Their Children To Attend School; And For Related Purposes.
